intro: Lomaria alternans, commonly known as the alternate lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Lomaria alternans is often found in rocky or dry soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its aromatic foliage and delicate flowers make it a notable addition to gardens and natural habitats.
